primaryKeyword: UK Bonus Tax, Bonus Tax Calculator
intro: Calculate your bonus tax in the UK with our comprehensive calculator. Bonuses are a significant part of many UK salaries, but understanding how they're taxed is crucial for accurate financial planning. Unlike regular salary, bonuses are taxed at your marginal PAYE rate, potentially pushing you into higher tax brackets. This calculator uses official 2026 HMRC rates to show you exactly how much tax you'll pay on bonuses, including PAYE income tax, National Insurance contributions (NIC), and pension deductions. Whether you're expecting a year-end bonus, performance bonus, or other supplemental pay, this tool helps you understand your true take-home bonus amount and overall compensation package.
howThisCalculatorWorks: This UK bonus tax calculator determines your take-home bonus by adding the bonus to your annual salary, then calculating UK taxes on the total amount. Bonuses are taxed at marginal rates - if your base salary puts you in the 20% bracket but the bonus pushes you into the 40% bracket, the entire bonus is taxed at 40%. National Insurance is calculated on total earnings. The calculator shows both the bonus tax breakdown and your total salary including bonus, helping you understand the overall tax impact. UK bonuses are typically paid as a lump sum and taxed under the PAYE system.

bonusTaxationRules.title: UK Bonus Taxation Rules
rules: **Marginal Rate Taxation:** Bonuses are taxed at your marginal PAYE rate, not averaged
**Total Earnings:** Bonuses are added to your annual salary for tax calculations
**Lump Sum:** Bonuses are typically paid as one-off payments, not spread over the year
**NIC Impact:** Higher total income may push bonuses into higher NIC bands
**Pension Impact:** Bonuses increase total earnings, affecting pension contributions
**Timing:** Bonuses can affect your tax code for the following year

faqs.question: How are bonuses taxed in the UK?
faqs.answer: Bonuses are added to your annual salary and taxed at your marginal PAYE rate. If your regular salary puts you in the 20% bracket but the bonus pushes you into the 40% bracket, the entire bonus is taxed at 40%. National Insurance is calculated on total earnings.

faqs.question: Are bonuses taxed differently from salary?
faqs.answer: No, bonuses are taxed the same as regular salary under PAYE, but at marginal rates rather than being averaged across the year. This can result in bonuses being taxed at higher rates than your standard salary.

faqs.question: Can I reduce bonus tax through salary sacrifice?
faqs.answer: Some UK employers offer salary sacrifice schemes where you can sacrifice part of your bonus for benefits like pensions or health insurance, which may reduce your taxable income. Check with your employer for available schemes.

faqs.question: When are bonuses usually paid in the UK?
faqs.answer: Bonuses in the UK are typically paid annually, often at year-end (March/April) or following the company's financial year-end. Some companies pay quarterly or half-yearly bonuses.

faqs.question: Do bonuses affect my Personal Allowance?
faqs.answer: Yes, bonuses increase your total income, which may affect your tax allowances and rate band. Higher income may reduce or eliminate certain allowances you're entitled to.
